OOC: I think Tucson opened his cab doors to let everyone out before he arri=
ved fully at the ark.  that may have been overlooked, no problem.

Okay, he=
re's where it gets interesting..  Tucson is able to fire and hit targets in=
 pure darkness, seeing that he is blind and has adapted to his disability, =
simply by sharpening up his other senses.  Hearing, touch smell, and if nee=
d be, taste.  It's up to you wether or not that arrow hits Nightrazor in th=
e knee or not.   The reason for this shot, is to disable but not destroy.  =
He wants him for questioning, and feels he can get a lot of intel out of hi=
m.  Then it will be up to everyone to decide which fate is best for Nightra=
zor. Rodimus will also have a say in what happens, as well as Lord Elder an=
d everyone else.  Tucson would like nothing more than to take out Nightrazo=
r, but being an Autobot, he feels that is not the answer to everyone's prob=
lems.  Nor does he have it in his spark to do such a thing.  If a decision =
is to be made, he feels that he must do so in an intelligent and fair manne=
r and to do this, means he has to consult others for advice.  Knowing and a=
dmitting that your'e not perfect is better than assuming that you are.  

-=
